sentences.en: Blacken easily with cold bath face?
sentences.cn: 用冷水洗脸容易变黑 吗 ?

sentences.en: Blacken'is a causative verb meaning cause to become black '.
sentences.cn: blacken是 使役动词,意思是`使变黑 '.

sentences.en: Can the bone after is the person that gets leukaemia dead blacken?
sentences.cn: 得白血病的人死后骨头会不会变黑 啊 ?

sentences.en: Do not blacken your fame, and perish in dishonour!
sentences.cn: 不要玷污你的名声, 不光彩地毁掉自己!

sentences.en: Don't blacken his good name by spreading lies.
sentences.cn: 不要散播谎言诋毁他的名声.

sentences.en: Don't blacken my name by spreading rumors.
sentences.cn: 不要散播流言,破坏我的名誉.

sentences.en: Face by abrade hind, good blacken of Gong Heigong how to do?
sentences.cn: 脸被擦伤后, 好了变黑红黑红的怎么办?

sentences.en: He accused him of knowingly spreading falsehoods in an effort to blacken my character.
sentences.cn: 他指控他蓄意散布虚假信息以玷污我的人格。

sentences.en: Hydrogenated oil ( esp. hydrogenated Diesel ) is prone to blacken and form deposit under the light.
sentences.cn: 加氢生成油 ( 尤其加氢柴油 ) 对光比较敏感,光照后油品颜色变黑,产生沉淀.

sentences.en: Mark felt a tinge of jealousy toward John and he tried to blacken the picture.
sentences.cn: 马克对约翰有几分嫉妒,因而极力贬低他.

sentences.en: No wool is so white that a dyer cannot blacken it.
The married women of Shitamachi maintained the custom of blackening their teeth.
sentences.cn: 下町的已婚妇女保留了染黑牙齿的习俗。

sentences.en: The media tried to blacken his name.
sentences.cn: 媒体企图抹黑他的形象.

sentences.en: The twilight had begun to whiten what was on high and to blacken all below.
sentences.cn: 暮色的残晖正开始把上面的东西变白，下面的东西变黑。

sentences.en: They're trying to blacken our name.
sentences.cn: 他们企图败坏我们的名声。

sentences.en: You need to grill the tomatoes until the skins blacken.
sentences.cn: 你得把番茄烤到皮变黑为止。

words.tran_cn: [天] 变黑；黑度；致黑；黑色涂料
黑色涂料；黑色鞋油；炭粉
[天] 变黑；使变黑；诋毁（blacken的ing形式）
使变黑；把鞋油等涂在…上；把（眼眶）打成青肿

trans.tran_en: To blacken something means to make it black or very dark in colour. Something that blackens becomes black or very dark in colour.

trans.tran_cn: 使变黑，把…弄黑，诽谤，诋毁，中伤（名誉等）
